snippet: John Cornelius Foley has moved away from the Bowery where he spent many years. For some of that time, he lived in a wooden box on Broome Street.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on John Cornelius Foley, who has moved away from the Bowery, where he lived, almost like a human museum piece in an exhibit about the Bowery as a skid row, in a wooden box on the street; Foley has started life over in a newly renovated rent-subsidized efficiency apartment in the Bronx that is owned by the Postgraduate Center for Mental Health.
lead_paragraph: John Cornelius Foley has moved away from the Bowery where he spent many years. For some of that time, he lived in a wooden box on Broome Street.

headline.seo: Living on His Own, Far From the Box
headline.main: Living on His Own, Far From the Box
headline.print_headline: Living on His Own, Far From the Box
